intro: Tibetiodes diplostephioides, commonly known as the Tibetan thistle, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to extreme climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually grayish-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces showy yellow to orange composite flowers. Tibetiodes diplostephioides is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
